seriesJson.title: Indian country
seriesJson.description: The problems of social adjustment in the attitudes and through the words of the modern Native Americans.

node.title: The Navajo makes his living
node.description: This program focuses on the Navajo people and how they make a living.

node.title: The Indian family today
node.description: This program discusses the modern Native American family.

node.title: The Sioux and what they want
node.description: This program focusses on members of the Sioux Nation and what they want.

node.title: The struggle for Indian education
node.description: This program takes a look at education for Native Americans.

node.title: The Indian at war
node.description: This program, "The Indian at War," looks at military service among Native Americans.

node.title: A look at Indian health
node.description: This program takes a look at the health of modern Native Americans.

node.title: A look at the Indian's future
node.description: The final program, "A Look at the Indian's Future," takes a look at what might lay ahead for Native American people.

node.title: The changing Indian
node.description: This program, "The Changing Indian," talks about the changes that have occurred in the typical Native American's life by the mid-20th century.

node.title: Future for the reservation Indian
node.description: This program looks at what lies ahead for Native Americans who live on reservations.

node.title: On Indians past and present
node.description: In the first program of this series, Dr. Ruth Underhill speaks to Native Americans from the Sioux and Navajo peoples and seeks to understand how they have adjusted to life in modern America.
